alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Boone; Cedar; Knox; Madison; Pierce; Platte; Stanton; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 24 at 2:23AM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations between 10 and 16 inches and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Nebraska. * WHEN...From midnight Sunday night to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay in your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Antelope; Boone; Cedar; Knox; Madison; Pierce; Platte; Stanton; Wayne
